title: How a Brexit deal will boost the economy – in five charts
text:
More than three years of market volatility, stunted growth and political paralysis could be finally coming to an end.

In the run-up to the EU referendum, Brexit doomsayers predicted that a decision to leave would trigger an instant recession. They were wrong but instead the life has slowly been sapped out of the economy in the three years since the vote as inaction, political bickering, repeated delays and threatened cliff edges raised chronic uncertainty to barely precedented levels.

Now that a draft departure deal has been struck, the economy faces a renaissance, unleashing pent-up investment, sending sterling higher and giving growth a much-needed shot in the arm.

These are the five charts...
description: More than three years of market volatility, stunted growth and political paralysis could be finally coming to an end.
